greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of q * (phi(q) * psi(q^4))^2 in powers of q where phi(), psi() are Ramanujan theta functions.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of (eta(q^2)^5 * eta(q^8)^2 / (eta(q)^2 * eta(q^4)^3))^2 in powers of q.
a(n) is multiplicative with a(2) = 4, a(2^e) = 0 if e>1, a(p^e) = (p^(e+1) - 1) / (p - 1) if p>2.
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (8 t)) = 2 (t/i)^2 g(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t) and g() is the g.f. for A133690.
a(n) = -(-1)^n * A121455(n). Convolution square of A113411.
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ (EllipticTheta[ 3, 0, q] EllipticTheta[ 2, 0, q^2]/2)^2, {q, 0, n}]; (* _Michael Somos_, Oct 30 2015 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = if( n<1, 0, if( n%2, sigma(n), if( n%4, 4 * sigma(n/2), 0)))};
(PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if ( n<1, 0, n--; A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( (eta(x^2 + A)^5 * eta(x^8 + A)^2 / (eta(x + A)^2 * eta(x^4 + A)^3) )^2, n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Sep 20 2007
